page.title: 20Home Life in Middleton
page.content: Home life revolves around the family. They have their main meal together, Evenings are spent maintaining or improving the home, watching TV, listening to radio or records, sewing, gardening, various hobbies, organising village functions, entertaining friends and relatives. The husband helps with household chores. About half the homes have a telephone. Most have as many as 15 electical appliances and about 80% own at least one car. Most have all standard amenities. Traditional English cooking is still the norm. Some homes have burglar alarms and special locks fitted. The most popular pet is the cat then dog, birds, fish and small mammals. The village has no shop or pub but many foods, hardware and newspapers are delivered regularly or sold by travelling vendors.
